extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.workday.GetWorkdayReport
extension.description: A processor which can interact with a configurable Workday Report. The processor can forward the content without modification, or you can transform it by providing the specific Record Reader and Record Writer services based on your needs. You can also remove fields by defining schema in the Record Writer. Supported Workday report formats are: csv, simplexml, json

property.name: Workday Report URL
property.description: HTTP remote URL of Workday report including a scheme of http or https, as well as a hostname or IP address with optional port and path elements.

property.name: Authorization Type
property.description: The type of authorization for retrieving data from Workday resources.

allowableValue.description: Used to access resources using Workday password and username.
Used to get fresh access tokens based on a previously acquired refresh token. Requires Client ID, Client Secret and Refresh Token.

property.name: Access Token Provider
property.description: Enables managed retrieval of OAuth2 Bearer Token.

property.name: Workday Username
property.description: The username provided for authentication of Workday requests. Encoded using Base64 for HTTP Basic Authentication as described in RFC 7617.

property.name: Workday Password
property.description: The password provided for authentication of Workday requests. Encoded using Base64 for HTTP Basic Authentication as described in RFC 7617.

property.name: Web Client Service Provider
property.description: Web client which is used to communicate with the Workday API.

property.name: record-reader
property.description: Specifies the Controller Service to use for parsing incoming data and determining the data's schema.

property.name: record-writer
property.description: The Record Writer to use for serializing Records to an output FlowFile.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: Request FlowFiles transferred when receiving socket communication errors.

relationship.name: original
relationship.description: Request FlowFiles transferred when receiving HTTP responses with a status code between 200 and 299.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: Response FlowFiles transferred when receiving HTTP responses with a status code between 200 and 299.

writesAttribute.name: getworkdayreport.java.exception.class
writesAttribute.description: The Java exception class raised when the processor fails

writesAttribute.name: getworkdayreport.java.exception.message
writesAttribute.description: The Java exception message raised when the processor fails

writesAttribute.name: mime.type
writesAttribute.description: Sets the mime.type attribute to the MIME Type specified by the Source / Record Writer

writesAttribute.name: record.count
writesAttribute.description: The number of records in an outgoing FlowFile. This is only populated on the 'success' relationship when Record Reader and Writer is set.
